docs.lead_paragraph: For years, Sal Salvaggio hid his legs. The ugly blue and red knots of veins that bulged out like clusters of grapes embarrassed him so much that he refused to wear shorts. Even more vexing was the weariness and pain he felt each evening, when he finally had a chance to rest his limbs. Mr. Salvaggio, a hair stylist in Manhattan, assumed he would just have to endure the blemishes and aches for the rest of his life. But one day, he struck up a conversation with one of his partner's customers, a well-known vein expert who had just developed a virtually painless procedure for treating varicose veins. ''I showed him my legs and he said, 'Come on over and I'll take care of them,' '' Mr. Salvaggio, 56, remembers.

headline.main: Now, Easier Ways to Eliminate Varicose Veins

docs.abstract: Easier techniques are developed to treat varicose veins, which affect 50 percent of women and 15 percent of men by age 55; one uses lasers, and the other radio waves (M)
